author: jsign
content:
I've finished the first version of my KZG ceremony client... I've contributed to the current sequencer, and things are looking fine.

To highlight here some feats apart from the obvious client contribution:
- Allows verifying the powers of tau calculation from the currently provided transcript from the verifier. People could also use this client as a verification angle for the current transcript. I think it's a good offer to the community.
- Apart from using CSRNG for secrets entropy, it supports two opt-in external sources of entropy: the drand network, and an arbitrary URL provided by the user. The latter was inspired by a talk with <@686695036733227017>  which is planning to contribute to the ceremony with cats entropy :). The idea is to provide a separate client to use your creative entropy source if you can at least offer it in a simple HTTP server endpoint. [I explain how this works in the README too]

I put some reasonable effort into explaining this client and how to use it in the README targeted for users, so I'd appreciate it if anyone wants to give it a read and provide any feedback üòÑ 
https://github.com/jsign/go-kzg-ceremony-client
(I haven't shared in twitter yet; for now sharing here if something can be improved)
